errors.40036: Default storage policy cannot be deleted.
errors.40037: {{message}} file(s) are using this policy, please delete those files first.
errors.40038: {{message}} group(s) are using this policy, please unlink those groups first.
errors.40040: Cannot perform such action on system group.
errors.40041: {{message}} users are still in this group, please delete or unlink those users first.
errors.40042: Cannot change the group of system user group.
errors.40043: Cannot perform such action on default user.
errors.40046: Cannot perform such action on master node.
errors.40060: Slave node cannot send callback request to master, please check master node setting: Basic - Site Information - Site URL, please make sure slave node can access this url. ({{message}})

summary.siteURLNotSet: You have not set the site URL yet, do you want to set it to the current {{current}} ?
summary.siteURLNotMatch: The site URL you set does not match the current one, do you want to set it to the {{current}} ?
summary.siteURLDescription: This setting is very important, make sure it matches the actual URL of your site. You can change this setting in Settings - Basic.

settings.subTitle: Subtitle
settings.siteKeywordsDes: Keywords of the website, separated by commas.
settings.siteDescriptionDes: Description of the website, which may be displayed in the shared page summary.
settings.siteURLDes: Very important, please make sure it is consistent with the actual situation. When using cloud storage policy and payment platform, please fill in the address that can be accessed by WAN.
settings.customFooterHTMLDes: Custom HTML code inserted at the bottom of the page.
settings.announcementDes: Announcements displayed to logged-in users. Blank value will not be displayed. After this content is changed, all users will see the announcement again.
settings.smallIconDes: URL of the small icon with the ico as extension
settings.mediumIconDes: URL of the medium icon, prefer size at 192x192, png format.
settings.largeIconDes: URL of the medium icon, prefer size at 512x512, png format. This icon will also be shown while switching account in iOS app.
settings.displayModeDes: The display mode of a PWA application after it's installed.
settings.themeColorDes: CSS color value that affect the color of the status bar on the PWA launch screen, the status bar in the content page, and the address bar.
settings.webauthnNoHttps: Web Authn requires your website to be HTTPS enabled, and please confirm that in Settings - Basic - Site URL also uses HTTPS.
settings.allowNewRegistrationsDes: After disabled, no new users can be registered, unless manually added by admins.
settings.emailActivationDes: After enabled, new users need to click the activation link in the email to complete signups. Please make sure the email delivery settings are correct, otherwise the activation email will not be delivered.
settings.captchaForSignupDes: Whether to enable the captcha for signups.
settings.captchaForLoginDes: Whether to enable the captcha for logins.
settings.captchaForResetDes: Whether to enable the captcha for resetting password.
settings.webauthnDes: Whether to allow users to log in using a hardware authenticator, the website must enable HTTPS for this to work.
settings.defaultGroupDes: The initial user group after user registration.
settings.testSMTPTooltip: Before sending a test email, please save the changed SMTP settings; the email delivery results will not be fed back immediately, if you do not receive a test email for a long time, please check the error log output by Cloudreve in the terminal.
settings.senderNameDes: The sender's name displayed in the email.
settings.smtpServerDes: SMTP server address, without port number.
settings.smtpUsernameDes: SMTP username, generally the same as the sender address.
settings.replyToAddressDes: The mailbox used to receive reply emails when users reply to emails sent by the system.
settings.enforceSSLDes: Whether to enforce an SSL encrypted connection. If you cannot send emails, you can turn this off and Cloudreve will try to use STARTTLS and decide whether to use encrypted connections.
settings.smtpTTLDes: SMTP connections established during the TTL period will be reused by new mail delivery requests.
settings.activateNewUserDes: Template for activation email after new user registration.
settings.workerNumDes: The maximum number of tasks to be executed in parallel by the master node task queue, restarting Cloudreve is needed to take effect.
settings.transitParallelNumDes: Maximum number of parallel co-processes for transfer tasks.
settings.tempFolderDes: Used to store temporary files generated by tasks such as decompression, compression, etc.
settings.textEditMaxSize: Max size of editable document files
settings.textEditMaxSizeDes: The maximum size of a document file that can be edited online, files beyond this size cannot be edited online. This setting applies to plain text, code and Office documents (WOPI).
settings.failedChunkRetryDes: Maximum number of retries after a failed chunk, only for server-side uploads or transferring.
settings.cacheChunksDes:
If enabled, streaming chunk uploads will cache chunk data in a temporary directory for retrying after failed uploads.
 If disabled, streaming chunk uploads do not take up additional hard disk space, but the entire upload will fail immediately after a single chunk failure.
settings.resetConnectionDes: If enabled, the server will force to reset the connection if upload verification fails.
settings.uploadSessionDes: For supported storage policy, user can resume uploads within upload session expiration. Max value various from third-party storage providers.
settings.downloadSessionForSharedDes: Repeated downloads of shared files within this set period of time will not be counted in the total number of downloads.
settings.onedriveMonitorIntervalDes: At set intervals, Cloudreve will request OneDrive to check client uploads to ensure they're under control.
settings.onedriveCallbackToleranceDes: Maximum time to wait for the callback after the OneDrive client has finished uploading, if it exceeds it, the upload will be considered failed.
settings.onedriveDownloadURLCacheDes: Cloudreve can cache the result after getting the file download URL to reduce the frequency of hot API requests.
settings.slaveAPIExpirationDes: Timeout time for master to wait for slave API request responses.
settings.heartbeatIntervalDes: The interval at which the master node sends heartbeats to slave nodes.
settings.heartbeatFailThresholdDes: The maximum number of retries the master can make after sending a heartbeat to a slave that fails. After all failed retries, the node will enter recovery mode.
settings.heartbeatRecoverModeIntervalDes: Interval between master attempts to reconnect to a node after the node has been marked as recovery mode.
settings.slaveTransitExpirationDes: Maximum time that can be consumed by a slave to execute a file transfer task.
settings.keepAtLeastOneTheme: Please reserve at least one theme.
settings.themeConfigDes: Full available configurations can be referred at <0>Default Theme - Material-UI</0>.
settings.defaultThemeDes: The default them to use when the user does not specify a preferred one.
settings.personalFileListView: Default view for personal file list
settings.personalFileListViewDes: The default display view to use when the user does not specify a preferred one.
settings.sharedFileListView: Default view for shared file list
settings.sharedFileListViewDes: The default display view to use when the user does not specify a preferred one.
settings.avatarFilePathDes: Path to save user's avatar files.
settings.avatarSizeDes: Maximum size of avatar files that users can upload.
settings.officePreviewServiceDes: You can use following magic variables：
settings.localOnlyInfo: The following settings only apply to local storage policies.
settings.thumbnailDoc: For more information about thumbnail, see the <0>document</0>.
settings.thumbMaxSizeDes: The maximum original file size for which thumbnails can be generated, thumbnails will not be generated if files exceed this size.
settings.generatorProxyWarning: By default, non-local storage policies will only use the "Native in storage policy" generator. You can extend the thumbnail capability of third-party storage policies by enabling the "Generator proxy" feature.
settings.policyBuiltinDes: Use the native API from storage provider to process thumbnails. For local and S3 policy, this generator is not available and will automatically fallback to other generators. For other storage policies, please refer to the Cloudreve documentation for supported image formats.
settings.cloudreveBuiltinDes: Only images in PNG, JPEG, GIF formats are supported using Cloudreve's built-in image processing capabilities.
settings.libreOfficeDes: Use LibreOffice to generate thumbnails for Office documents. This generator depends on any other image thumbnail generator (Cloudreve built-in or VIPS).
settings.vipsDes: Use libvips to process thumbnail images, support more image formats, and consume less resources.
settings.thumbDependencyWarning: LibreOffice generators depend on Cloudreve built-in or VIPS generators, please enable either one.
settings.ffmpegDes: Use FFmpeg to generate video thumbnails.
settings.executableDes: The address or command of the third-party generator executable.
settings.generatorExtsDes: List of available file extensions for this generator, please use comma , to separate multiple ones.
settings.ffmpegSeekDes: Define the thumbnail interception time, it is recommended to choose a smaller value to speed up the generation process. If the actual length of the video is exceeded, the thumbnail generation will fail.
settings.proxyPolicyListDes: Multi-selectable. If enabled, files whose storage policy does not support native generation, its thumbnails will be proxy generated by the Cloudreve.
settings.thumbQualityDes: Compression quality percentage, valid only for jpg encoding.
settings.captchaElement: Elements inside of the captcha image.
settings.siteKeyDes: You can find it at <0>App Management Page</0>.
settings.siteSecretDes: You can find it at <0>App Management Page</0>.
settings.secretIDDes: You can find it at <0>Access Management Page</0>.
settings.secretKeyDes: You can find it at <0>Access Management Page</0>.
settings.tCaptchaAppIDDes: You can find it at <0>Captcha Management Page</0>.
settings.tCaptchaSecretKeyDes: You can find it at <0>Captcha Management Page</0>.
settings.staticResourceCacheDes: Max age of cache for public accessible static resources (e.g. local policy source link, download link).
settings.wopiClientDes: Extend Cloudreve's document online preview and editing capabilities by interfacing with online document processing systems that support the WOPI protocol. For more information, please refer to <0>Official Documentation</0>.
settings.wopiEndpointDes: Endpoint URL of WOPI Discovery API.
settings.wopiSessionTtlDes: The user opens an online editing document session with an expiration date, beyond which the session cannot continue to save new changes.

policy.name: Name
policy.pathMagicVarDes: Enter the physical path to the folder you want to store files. Either absolute or relative (relative to Cloudreve executable) path is supported. You can use magic variables in the path, which will be automatically replaced with the corresponding values when the file is uploaded; see <0>List of path magic variables</0> for available magic variables.
policy.filePathMagicVarDes: Do you want to rename the physical files that are uploaded? The renaming here will not affect the final file name presented to the user. Magic variables can also be used for file names, see <0>List of Magic Variables for file names</0> for available magic variables.
policy.enableGettingPermanentSourceLink: Allow user to get permanent file source link?
policy.enableGettingPermanentSourceLinkDes: When enabled, users can obtain a direct link to the contents of the file, for use in the Image Bed application or for your own use. You may also need to enable this feature in the user group settings to make it available for users.
policy.useCDN: Do you want to use CDN for download and source links?
policy.useCDNDes: When enabled, the domain part of the URL which user uses to access files will be replaced with the CDN domain.
policy.cdnDomain: Select a protocol and enter the CDN domain:
policy.limitFileSize: Do you want to limit the max size of one single file that can be uploaded?
policy.limitFileExt: Do you want to limit file extensions？
policy.enterFileExt: Enter the file extensions allowed to be uploaded, separated by semi-colon commas:
policy.chunkSizeLabel: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. A value of 0 means no resumable uploads are used.
policy.chunkSizeDes: After enabling resumable upload, the files uploaded by users will be sliced into chunks and uploaded to the storage side one by one. After the upload is interrupted, users can choose to continue uploading from the last uploaded chunk.
policy.nameThePolicy: Last step, name the storage policy:
policy.furtherActions: To use this storage policy, go to the user group setting page and bind this storage policy for the appropriate user group.
policy.remoteDescription: The remote storage policy allows you to use a server that is also running Cloudreve as the slave storage node, and users' upload and download traffic are directly transmitted over HTTP.
policy.remoteCopyBinaryDescription: Copy the Cloudreve executable with the same version as master to the server you want to use as a slave storage node.
policy.remoteSecretDescription: The following is the randomly generated slave secret, usually no need to change. If you have customization requirement, you can fill in your own secret into the following field.
policy.modifyRemoteConfig: Modify the Cloudreve config file on slave node.
policy.addRemoteConfigDes: Create a new <0>conf.ini</0> file in the same directory as the slave Cloudreve, fill in the slave configuration, and start/restart the slave Cloudreve. The following is an example configuration for your slave Cloudreve, where the secret section is pre-filled in for you as generated in the previous step.
policy.remoteConfigDifference: The configuration file format on the slave side is roughly the same as the master side, with the following differences:
policy.remoteConfigDifference1: The <1>mode</1> field under the <0>System</0> section must be changed to <2>slave</2>.
policy.remoteConfigDifference2: You must specify the <1>Secret</1> field under the <0>Slave</0> section, whose value is the secret filled in or generated in step 2.
policy.remoteConfigDifference3: The cross-origin configuration, i.e. the contents of the <0>CORS</0> field, must be enabled, as described in the example above or in the official documentation. If the configuration is not correct, users will not be able to upload files to the slave node via the web browser.
policy.inputRemoteAddressDes: If HTTPS is enabled on the master, the slave also needs to enable it and fill in the address with HTTPS protocol below.
policy.testCommunicationDes: After completing the above steps, you can test if the communication is working by clicking the test button below.
policy.pathMagicVarDesRemote: Enter the physical path to the folder you want to store files. Either absolute or relative (relative to slave Cloudreve executable) path is supported. You can use magic variables in the path, which will be automatically replaced with the corresponding values when the file is uploaded; see <0>List of path magic variables</0> for available magic variables.
policy.wanSiteURLDes: Before using this policy, please make sure that the address you entered in Basic Settings - Site Information - Site URL matches the actual address and <0>can be accessed properly by WAN</0>.
policy.createQiniuBucket: Go to <0>Qiniu dashboard</0> to create a storage bucket.。
policy.enterQiniuBucket: Enter the "bucket name" you just created:
policy.bucketTypeDes: Select the type of bucket you just created. We recommend selecting "Private bucket" for higher security.
policy.bucketCDNDes: Fill in the CDN-accelerated domain name you have bound for the storage bucket.
policy.qiniuCredentialDes: Go to Personal Center - Credential Management in the Qiniu dashboard and fill in the obtained AK, SK.
policy.cannotEnableForPrivateBucket: If this feature is enabled for private bucket, you need to enable "Use redirected source link" for user groups.
policy.limitMimeType: Do you want to limit MimeTypes of file that can be uploaded?
policy.mimeTypeDes: Enter the MimeType of the allowed files, and separate multiple MimeTypes with a comma. Qiniu will detect the file content to determine the MimeType, and allow the upload if the MimeType is presented in your list.
policy.chunkSizeLabelQiniu: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. Allowed range is 1 MB - 1 GB.
policy.createPlaceholderDes: Do you want to create a placeholder file and deduct user capacity when users start uploading? If enabled, Cloudreve will prevent users from maliciously initiating multiple upload requests but not completing the upload.
policy.editOSSStoragePolicy: Edit Alibaba Cloud OSS storage policy
policy.addOSSStoragePolicy: Add Alibaba Cloud OSS storage policy
policy.createOSSBucketDes: Go to <0>OSS Dashboard</0> to create a Bucket。Attention: You can only use bucket with SKU of <1>Standard storage</1> or <2>Low frequency storage</2>, <3>Archive storage</3> is not supported.
policy.ossEndpointDes: Go to Bucket summary page, enter the <2>Endpoint</2> under <1>External access</1> section, in <0>Access domain</0> page.
policy.endpointDomainOnly: Wrong format, just enter the hostname of the domain.
policy.ossLANEndpointDes: If your Cloudreve is deployed in Alibaba Cloud compute related services which are under the same availability zone as the OSS bucket, you can additionally specify a intranet endpoint, Cloudreve will try to use this endpoint on server side to reduce traffic cost. Do you want to use the OSS intranet endpoint?
policy.ossCDNDes: Do you want to use Alibaba Cloud CDN to speed up file access?
policy.createOSSCDNDes: Go to <0>Alibaba Cloud CDN Dashboard</0> to create a CDN domain, the source of the CDN should be your OSS bucket. Enter the CDN domain and select if you want to use HTTPS:
policy.ossAKDes: Obtain your AccessKey in <0>Security Information Management</0> page, fill in the AccessKey below:
policy.chunkSizeLabelOSS: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. Allowed range is 100 KB - 5 GB.
policy.ossCORSDes: This storage policy requires a CORS policy to enable uploading from browser. Cloudreve can set it up automatically for you, or you can set it up manually by following the steps in the documentation. If you have already set the CORS policy for this Bucket, this step can be skipped.
policy.letCloudreveHelpMe: Let Cloudreve set it for me
policy.createUpyunBucketDes: Go to <0>Upyun Dashboard</0> to create a storage service.
policy.storageServiceNameDes: Enter the name of your storage service:
policy.operatorNameDes: Create an operators for this service, authorize the operators with read, write, and delete permissions, fill in the operator information below.
policy.upyunCDNDes: Fill in the domain bound for the storage service, and choose whether to use HTTPS.
policy.upyunOptionalDes: You can skip this step and keep it as default, but we strongly suggest you follow below instructions.
policy.upyunTokenDes: Go to the Feature Configuration panel of the created storage service, go to the Access Configuration tab, enable Token Anti-Hotlinking and set a secret.
policy.upyunTokenSecretDes: Enter the secret of the Token Anti-Hotlinking.
policy.cannotEnableForTokenProtectedBucket: This feature is not supported if you enable Token Anti-Hotlinking.
policy.createCOSBucketDes: Go to <0>COS Dashboard</0> to create a storage bucket.
policy.cosBucketNameDes: Go to basic setting page of created bucket, enter <0>Bucket name</0> below:
policy.cosBucketFormatError: Bucket name format is not correct, an example: ccc-1252109809
policy.cosBucketTypeDes: Below you can select the type of access control for the bucket you created. We recommend selecting <0>Private Read/Write</0> for higher security, private bucket do not have the "Get Source Link" feature.
policy.cosAccessDomainDes: Go to the base configuration of the created Bucket and fill in the <1>Access Domain</1> given under the <0>Basic Information</0> section.
policy.cosCDNDes: Do you want to use Tencent Cloud CDN to speed up file access?
policy.cosCDNDomainDes: Go to <0>Tencent Cloud CDN Management Console</0> to create a CDN acceleration domain and set the source site to the COS bucket you just created. Fill in the CDN domain name below and select whether to use HTTPS.
policy.cosCredentialDes: Get a pair of access keys from the Tencent Cloud <0>Access Keys</0> page and fill them in below. Please make sure the pair of keys has access permission to COS and SCF services.
policy.cosCallbackDes: COS Storage Bucket Client-side direct transfer requires the use of Tencent Cloud's <0>Cloud Functions</0> product to ensure controlled upload callbacks. This step can be skipped if you intend to use this storage policy on your own, or assign it to a trusted user group. If it is for public use, please make sure to create callback cloud functions.
policy.cosCallbackCreate: Cloudreve can try to automatically create the callback cloud function for you, please select the region of the COS bucket and continue. It may take a few seconds to create, so please be patient. Please make sure your Tencent Cloud account has cloud function service enabled before creating.
policy.odHttpsWarning: You must enable HTTPS to use OneDrive/SharePoint storage policies; after enabled, make sure to change Settings - Basic - Site Information - Site URL.
policy.creatAadAppDes: Go to <0>Azure Active Directory Dashboard (Worldwide cloud)</0> or <1>Azure Active Directory Dashboard (21V Chinese cloud)</1>, after logging in, go to the <2>Azure Active Directory</2> admin panel, you can optionally use an account different from the one used to store files to login.
policy.createAadAppDes2: Go to the <0>App Registrations</0> menu on the left and click the <1>New registration</1> button.
policy.createAadAppDes3: Fill out the application registration form. Makse sure <0>Supported account types</0> is selected as <1>	Accounts in any organizational directory (Any Azure AD directory - Multitenant) and personal Microsoft accounts (e.g. Skype, Xbox)</1>; <2>Redirect URI (optional)</2> is selected as <3>Web</3> and fill in <4>{{url}}</4>; For other fields, just leave it as default.
policy.aadAppIDDes: Once created, go to the <0>Overview</0> page in Application Management, copy the <1>Application (Client) ID</1> and fill in the following fields:
policy.addAppSecretDes: Go to the <0>Certificates & secrets</0> menu on the left side, click the <1>New client secret</1> button, and select <3>Never</3> for the <2>Expires</2>. After you are done creating the client secret, fill in the value of the client secret below:
policy.sharePointDes: Do you want to store files in SharePoint?
policy.odReverseProxyURLDes: Do you want to use custom reverse proxy server for file downloading？
policy.chunkSizeLabelOd: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. OneDrive requires it must be an integer multiple of 320 KiB (327,680 bytes).
policy.limitOdTPSDes: Do you want to add a limit to the frequency of server-side OneDrive API requests?
policy.tpsDes: Limit this storage policy the maximum number of API requests sent to OneDrive per second. Requests that exceed this frequency will be rate-limited. When multiple Cloudreve nodes transferring files, they each use their own token bucket, so please scale this number down as appropriate in this condition.
policy.tpsBurstDes: When requested is idle, Cloudreve can reserve a specified number of slots for future bursts of traffic.
policy.odOauthDes: However, you will need to click the button below and authorize with Microsoft account login to complete the initialization before you can use it. You can re-authorize later on the Storage Policy List page.
policy.s3SelfHostWarning: AWS S3 storage policies are currently only safe for your own use, or for trusted user groups.
policy.s3BucketDes: Go to AWS S3 dashboard to create a bucket, enter the <0>Bucket name</0> you just created:
policy.s3EndpointDes: (Optional) Specify the EndPoint (geographical node) of the storage bucket in full URL format, e.g. <0>https://bucket.region.example.com</0>. Leaving it blank will use the system-generated default endpoint.
policy.selectRegionDes: Select the region where the storage bucket is located or enter the region code manually.
policy.enterAccessCredentials: Obtain a pair of access credential and fill in below:
policy.chunkSizeLabelS3: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. Allowed range is 5 MB - 5 GB.
policy.privateBucketDes: Whether the storage bucket is private.
policy.resourceRootURLDes: Prefix of URL generated for previewing and downloading.
policy.maxSizeBytesDes: Max file size can be uploaded, 0 means no limit.
policy.allowGetSourceLinkDes: Whether to allow getting source links. Note that some storage policy types are not supported, and even if they are turned on here, the obtained source links will be invalid.
policy.odDriverIDDes: Available only for OneDrive policy, blank means use default OneDrive driver.
policy.s3Only: Available only for AWS S3 policy.
policy.chunkSizeBytesDes: Size of chunk for resumable uploads. Only supported in partial storage policy.
policy.placeHolderWithSizeDes: Whether to create a placeholder file before uploading .Only supported in partial storage policy.
policy.s3EndpointPathStyle: Select the format of the S3 Endpoint address, or if you don't know what to select, just leave to the default. Some third-party S3-compatible storage policies may require this option to work. When turned on, we will force to use of path-like format addresses, such as <0>http://s3.amazonaws.com/BUCKET/KEY</0>.
policy.thumbExtDes: Leave blank to indicate that the storage policy predefined set is used. Not valid for local, S3 storage policies.

node.name: Name
node.slaveNodeDes: You can add a server that is also running Cloudreve as a slave node. A slave node can share the load of certain asynchronous tasks (such as remote downloads) for the master. Please refer to the following wizard to deploy and configure a slave node. <0> If you have already deployed a remote node storage policy on the target server, you can skip some steps on this page and just fill in the slave secret and server address here, keep them as the same in the remote storage policy. </0> In subsequent releases, the configuration related to the remote storage policy will be merged into here.
node.overwriteDes: ; The following settings are optional and correspond to the relevant parameters of the master node, <0></0>; which can be applied to the slave node via the configuration file, please adjust them according to <0></0>; the actual situation. Changing the following settings requires a restart of the slave node to take effect.
node.workerNumDes: Maximum number of tasks to be executed in parallel in the task queue.
node.parallelTransferDes: Maximum number of parallel goroutine when transferring files in the task queue
node.chunkRetriesDes: Maximum number of retries after a failed upload of a chunk.
node.multipleMasterDes: A slave Cloudreve instance can interface to multiple Cloudreve master nodes; simply add this slave node to all master nodes and keep the secret consistent.
node.aria2Des: Cloudreve's remote download functionality is powered by <0>Aria2</0>. To use it, start Aria2 as the same user running Cloudreve on the target node server, and enable the RPC service in the Aria2 config file, <1>Aria2 needs to share the same file system as the {{mode}} Cloudreve process. </1> For more information and guidelines, refer the <2>Offline Downloads</2> section of the documentation.
node.slaveTakeOverRemoteDownload: Do you need this node to take over remote download tasks?
node.masterTakeOverRemoteDownload: Do you need the master to take over the remote download task?
node.routeTaskSlave: After enabled, users' remote download requests can be scheduled to this node for processing.
node.routeTaskMaster: After enabled, users' remote download requests can be scheduled to master node for processing.
node.slaveNodeTarget: on slave node which shares the same file system with slave Cloudreve
node.masterNodeTarget: which shares the same file system with Cloudreve
node.aria2ConfigDes: Boot Aria2 {{target}} which shares the same file system with Cloudreve. When you start Aria2, you need to enable the RPC service in its config file and set the RPC Secret for future use. The following is a config example for reference.
node.rpcSecretComment: RPC secret, you can change it on your own.
node.rpcConfigDes: It is recommended to start Aria2 before the node Cloudreve in the routine startup process, so that node Cloudreve can subscribe to event notifications to Aria2 and download status changes are handled in a more timely manner. Of course, if this process is not available, node Cloudreve will also track the task status via polling.
node.rpcServerDes: Fill in the address of the RPC service that {{mode}} Cloudreve uses to communicate with Aria2. This can be filled in as <0>http://127.0.0.1:6800/</0>, where the port number <1>6800</1> is consistent with <2>rpc-listen-port</2> in the config file above.
node.rpcServerHelpDes: RPC server address contain full port number, e.g. http://127.0.0.1:6800/, Leave blank to indicate that the Aria2 service is not enabled.
node.rpcTokenDes: RPC secret, consistent with <0>rpc-secret</0> in the Aria2 configuration file; leave blank if not set.
node.aria2PathDes: Fill in the <0>absolute path</0> on the node that Aria2 uses as a temporary download directory. The Cloudreve process on the node needs read, write, and execute permissions on this directory.
node.aria2SettingDes: Fill in some additional Aria2 parameter information below, as your need.
node.refreshIntervalDes: The interval at which Cloudreve requests a refresh of the task state from Aria2.
node.rpcTimeoutDes: Maximum wait time when calling RPC services.
node.globalOptionsDes: Additional settings carried when creating a download job, written in JSON encoded format, you can also write these settings in the Aria2 config file, see the Aria2 official documentation for available settings.
node.testAria2Des: Once you have completed these steps, you can click the Test button below to test that if {{mode}} Cloudreve is communicating properly to Aria2.
node.testAria2DesSlaveAddition: Please make sure you have performed and passed the "Slave Communication Test" on the previous page before performing the test.
node.nameNode: Enter the name of this node:
node.loadBalancerRankDes: Specify a load balancing weight for this node, the value is an integer. Some load balancing policies will weight the nodes based on this value.
node.nodeSavedFutureAction: If you add a new node, you will also need to manually enable the node in the node list for it to work properly.

group.name: Name
group.atLeastOnePolicy: At least one storage policy is required.
group.storageDes: Select the storage policy that this group use.
group.availablePoliciesDes: Select the storage policies that this group can use.
group.initialStorageQuotaDes: Max storage can used by single user under this group.
group.downloadSpeedLimitDes: Fill in 0 to indicate no limit. When the restriction is turned on, the maximum download speed will be limited when users under this user group download all files under the storage policy that supports the speed limit.
group.bathSourceLinkLimit: Max size of batch source links
group.bathSourceLinkLimitDes: For the files under the supported storage policy, the maximum number of files allowed for users to obtain source links in a single batch, fill in 0 means no batch generation of source links is allowed.
group.allowCreateShareLinkDes: If disabled, users cannot create sharing links.
group.allowDownloadShareDes: If disabled, user cannot download shared files.
group.allowWabDAVDes: If disabled, users cannot connect to the storage via the WebDAV protocol
group.allowWabDAVProxyDes: If enabled, users can configure the WebDAV to proxy traffic when downloading files
group.disableMultipleDownloadDes: Valid only for local storage policies. When disabled, users cannot use the multi-threaded download tool.
group.allowRemoteDownloadDes: Whether to allow users to create remote download tasks
group.aria2OptionsDes: The additional parameters that this user group carries when creating remote download tasks. Options are written in JSON encoded format, you can also write these settings in the Aria2 configuration file, see the official documentation for available parameters.
group.aria2BatchSize: Max size of batch Aria2 tasks
group.aria2BatchSizeDes: The number of simultaneous remote download tasks allowed for the user, fill in 0 or leave blank to indicate no limit.
group.serverSideBatchDownloadDes: Whether to allow users to select multiple files to use the server-side relay batch download, after disabled, users can still use the pure browser based batch download feature.
group.compressTaskDes: Whether allow the user to create the compression/decompression task
group.compressSize: Maximum file size to be compressed
group.compressSizeDes: The maximum total file size of compression jobs that can be created by the user, fill in 0 to indicate no limit.
group.decompressSize: Maximum file size to be decompressed
group.decompressSizeDes: The maximum total file size of decompression jobs that can be created by the user, fill in 0 to indicate no limit.
group.migratePolicyDes: Whether the user creates a storage policy migration task.
group.allowSelectNodeDes: When enabled, user can select preferred slave node before creating remote download task. When disabled, the node will be load-balanced by system.
group.redirectedSourceDes: When enabled, the source link to the file obtained by the user will be redirected by Cloudreve with a shorter link. When disabled, the source link to the file obtained by the user becomes the original URL to the file. Some policies produce non-redirected source links that do not remain persistent, see <0>Comparing Storage Policies</0>.
group.availableNodesDes: Select the slave nodes that this group can use to create remote download tasks. Empty list means all nodes are available. Users can only select or be assigned nodes within this list by load balancer.
group.advanceDeleteDes: Once enabled, users can choose whether to force deletion and whether to unlink only physical links when deleting files. These options are similar to the administration dashboard when deleting files.

user.groupDes: Group that the user belongs to.
user.2FASecretDes: Secret of the 2FA authenticator, leave blank to disable 2FA.

file.name: File name
file.deleteAsync: Delete task will be executed in background.
file.importTaskCreated: Import task created, you can view its status in the Tasks - General.
file.manuallyPathOnly: The selected storage policy only supports manually inputting path.
file.importExternalFolderDes: You can import existing files and directory structures from your storage policy into Cloudreve. The import operation will not take up additional physical storage, but will still deduct the user's used storage quota as normal. The import will be halted when there is not enough quota.
file.storagePolicyDes: Select the storage policy where the files to be imported are currently stored.
file.targetUserDes: Select which user's file system you want to import the files to, you can search users by nickname or email.
file.selectSrcDes: The path of the directory to be imported on the storage side.
file.dstFolderPathDes: Path in the user's file system to hold all imported files.
file.recursivelyImportDes: Whether to import all subdirectories under the directory recursively.

task.aria2Des: Cloudreve's remote download support a master-slave decentralized mode. You can configure multiple Cloudreve slave nodes that can be used to handle remote download tasks, spreading the pressure on the master node. Of course, you can also configure to handle remote downloads only on the master node, which is the easiest way.
task.masterAria2Des: If you only need to enable remote downloads on the master node, <0>click here</0> to edit the master node.
task.slaveAria2Des: If you want to distribute remote download tasks on slave nodes, <0>click here</0> to add and configure a new node.
task.editGroupDes: When you add multiple nodes that can be used for remote downloads, the master node will send remote download requests to these nodes in turn for processing. You may also need to <0>go here</0> to enable remote download permissions for the corresponding groups.

vas.initialFilesDes: Specify the files that the user initially owns after signups. Enter a file ID to search existing files.
vas.appLinkDes: Will be displayed in mobile client, leave empty to hide menu item, This setting will take effect only if VOL license is valid.
vas.filterEmailProviderRuleDes: Separate multiple fields with a semi-colon comma.
vas.qqConnectHint: When creating the application, please fill in the callback URL: {{url}}
vas.enableQQConnectDes: Whether to allow binding QQ, use QQ to login website.
vas.loginWithoutBindingDes: After enabled, if a user logs in using QQ but does not have a registered user that is bound to it, the system will create a user for them and log them in. Users created in this way will only be able to log in using QQ in the future.
vas.appidDes: The APP ID obtained from the application management page.
vas.appKeyDes: The APP KEY obtained from the application management page.
vas.overuseReminderDes: Reminder email template sent to users after their capacity exceeds the limit due to expired VAS.
vas.rsaPrivateDes: The RSA2 (SHA256) private key for the payment application, typically generated by you. For details, refer to <0>Generating RSA Keys</0>.
vas.alipayPublicKeyDes: Provided by Alipay, available in Application Management - Application Information - API Signing Method.
vas.customPaymentEndpointDes: URL to be requested when creating a payment order.
vas.applicationIDDes: Public number or mobile application appid applied by merchants.
vas.merchantIDDes: The merchant number generated and issued by WeChat Pay.
vas.apiV3SecretDes: The merchant needs to set the secret in [Merchant Platform] - [API Security] before the request WeChat Pay. The length of the key is 32 bytes.
vas.mcCertificateSerialDes: Navigate to [API Security] - [API Certificate] - [View Certificate] to view the merchant API certificate serial number.
vas.mcAPISecretDes: Content of the secret file apiclient_key.pem.
vas.customPaymentSecretDes: Secret key for signing payment requests.
vas.payjsWarning: This service is provided by <0>PAYJS</0>, a third-party platform, and any disputes arising from it are not the responsibility of Cloudreve developers.
vas.mcNumberDes: Available in the PAYJS admin panel home page.
vas.banBufferPeriodDes: The maximum length of time that a user can maintain the capacity overage status, beyond which the user will be suspend by the system.
vas.customPaymentNameDes: Name of the payment method used to display to the user.
vas.allowSellSharesDes: Once enabled users can set a credit price for sharing and credit will be deducted for downloading.
vas.creditPriceRatioDes: The rate of credits actually arriving to the sharer for the purchase of a share with a set price for download.
vas.allowReportShareDes: When enabled, any user can report sharing and there is a risk of the database filling up.
vas.name: Name
vas.durationGroupDes: The validity of the purchase time of the user group unit upgraded after the purchase.
vas.highlightDes: After enabled, it will be highlighted on the product selection page.
vas.customPaymentDes: Bridge to other third party payment platforms by implementing Cloudreve compatible payment interfaces, please refer to <0>Official Documentation</0> for details.
vas.productQytDes: For credit products, this is the number of points and other products are multiples of durations.
vas.freeDownloadDes: After enabled, user can download paid shares for free.
vas.durationDayDes: Valid duration of each storage pack.
vas.priceCreditsDes: The price when using credits to buy, fill in 0 means you can't use credits to buy.
vas.showAppPromotionDes: After enabled, user can see the guidance page for mobile application in "Connect & Mount" page.
vas.productDescriptionDes: Description of the product displayed on the purchase page.
vas.numberOfCodesDes: Number of gift codes to generate.
vas.volPurchase: The client VOL license needs to be purchased separately from the <0>License Management Dashboard</0>. The VOL license allows your users to connect to your site using the <1>Cloudreve iOS</1> for free, without the need for users to pay for a subscription for the iOS app itself. After purchasing a license, please click "Sync License" below.
